item.title: [HBASE-11825] Create Connection and ConnectionManager
item.description:
This is further cleanup of the HBase interface for 1.0 after implementing the new Table and Admin interfaces. Following Enis's guidelines in HBASE-10602, this JIRA will generate a new ConnectionManager to replace HCM and Connection to replace HConnection.

For more detail, this JIRA intends to implement this portion:


interface Connection extends Closeable{

  Table getTable(), and rest of HConnection methods 

  getAdmin()

  // no deprecated methods (cache related etc)

}



@Deprecated

interface HConnection extends Connection {

  @Deprecated

  HTableInterface getTable()

  // users are encouraged to use Connection

}



class ConnectionManager {

  createConnection(Configuration) // not sure whether we want a static factory method to create connections or a ctor

}



@Deprecated

class HCM extends ConnectionManager {

  // users are encouraged to use ConnectionManager

}

  • removed the TODO line
  • replaced “an Table” with “a Table”
  • added try/finally blocks to comments about creating and using connections in ConnectionFactory and HConnectionManager. Also using getTable(TableName.valueOf("mytable")) instead of getTable("mytable") in the comments.

I did not make the change about isConnection(). I’ll defer to the wisdom of this illustrious group about whether or not isClosed() belongs on Connection or not.

I'll look at this tonight. My peeve was to get rid of the need to create threadpool and potentially HConnection each time you make a new HTable and hence leading abominations like the HTablePools and the weird HConnection caching we're doing. As long as we get rid of those two I am happy.
